page.title: 01EDGMOND -TIBBERTON
page.content: This is an agricultural area in {Shropshire}including parts of the villages of{Edgmond}(population 1462) and{Tibberton}(545 in October 1984) and{Harper Adams Agricultural College. The River Meese flows through Tibberton and to the south was moorland drained in the early nineteenth century by the{Duke of {Sutherland.}Tibberton village was part of his estate until 1912. Edgmond is on a hill overlooking a disused branch of the{Shropshire Union Canal. } Both villages look to the market town of{Newport}(population 8934) as their shopping and business centre, two miles from Edgmond and four from Tibberton. The new town of{Telford}is about eight miles to the south.This area is in the{Wrekin District.
